repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Agrarian Reform
            Communities Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Agrarian Reform
            Communities Development Project for Philippines were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: the cost sharing arrangements
            among project beneficiaries, Local Government Unit (LGU) and
            the project had maximized available resources, thus
            benefiting the greatest number of people. However, the new
            cost sharing scheme applied in this project was too high for
            most lower-income LGUs. Development interventions, for these
            to be effective in improving the income and welfare of the
            intended client, should involve a holistic and integrated
            package of assistance. These include investments in capacity
            building and skills development of target beneficiaries
            (social capital), technical and financial assistance for
            livelihood and income enhancement, and infrastructure
            development. The mix and level of these interventions should
            depend on the priority needs and capacity of the
            beneficiaries, including the availability of service institutions.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Reducing poverty and
            improving the quality of life in agrarian reform communities

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            reducing poverty and improving the quality of life in
            agrarian reform communities in Philippines. In 2002, about
            37 percent of the rural population in the Philippines lived
            below the poverty line. An integral part of the
            government's strategy for reducing poverty and inequity
            in land ownership, particularly in rural areas, had been the
            land reform program implemented through the Comprehensive
            Agrarian Reform Program. The project funded by World Bank
            implemented community development and capacity-building
            activities to ensure active community participation and
            self-reliance among agrarian reform beneficiaries and
            organizations. Using a community-driven approach, rural
            infrastructure was provided based on the prioritized needs
            of the communities. It included rural roads, bridges,
            small-scale irrigation, potable water supply systems and
            post-harvest facilities. Through the assistance of the World
            Bank, the Philippines boosted agricultural and enterprise
            productivity by at least 17 percent over the life of the
            project and had increased the household incomes of
            smallholder farmers and their families by about 21 percent
            in 124 communities by improving their access to agriculture
            and related support services.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Additional Financing for the
            Second Agrarian Reform Communities Development Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The closing date for Philippines'
            additional financing for the Second Agrarian Reform
            Communities Development Project is requested to be extended
            from June 30, 2010 until December 31, 2010. The
            recently-concluded implementation review mission (April
            2010) has confirmed the continued satisfactory
            implementation progress of the project. Overall physical
            accomplishment of the original and additional financing loan
            is reported at 98 percent, with an elapsed time of 96
            percent, based on the revised closing date of June 30, 2010.
            The remaining critical activities consist of eleven
            infrastructure subprojects funded mostly under the US$10
            million additional financing. Four of these subprojects
            would not be completed by the closing date of June 30, 2010.
            This has occurred due to delays in the release of funds from
            the Central Government which affected implementation of
            physical works. The extension is necessary to complete the
            remaining eleven irrigation subprojects. The
            Government's various implementing organizations have
            agreed on specific catch-up plans to ensure completion of
            the subprojects during the extension period. This will be
            the first extension of the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Agrarian Reform
            Communities Development Project : additional financing

abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper provides an
            additional loan to the Government of the Philippines (GOP)
            for the Second Agrarian Reform Communities Development
            Project (ARCDP2). The Bank is the only international
            financing institution for this project. The additional loan
            will help finance the shortfall in resources required to
            complete the remaining critical infrastructure investments
            of the project. The shortfall is largely due to the
            depreciation of the U.S. Dollar (US$) Vis&Vis the
            Philippine Peso (PhP) and local inflationary factors since
            2006. The additional financing request is accompanied by
            requests for: (a) an extension of the current loan closing
            date from December 31, 2009 to June 30, 2010; (b) a change
            in the current fund management arrangement (for
            infrastructure subprojects) from the Municipal Development
            Fund Office (MDFO) to the Department of Agrarian Reform
            (DAR); and (c) the application of retroactive financing
            amounting to 20 percent of the additional financing amount.
            The project objectives and design remain the same, although
            its scope in terms of outreach is wider than indicated at
            appraisal, given the community driven development (CDD)
            feature of the project.

Philippines - Second Agrarian Reform

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Agrarian Reform
            Communities Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall goal of the Second Agrarian
            Reform Communities Development Project for the Philippines
            is to reduce rural poverty and enhance the quality of life
            of the target beneficiaries, comprised of primarily agrarian
            reform beneficiaries. There are six project components.
            Component 1 increases active community participation and
            self-reliance in the planning processes of Agrarian Reform
            Communities (ARC) and in implementing integrated
            community-identified priorities. It also builds the capacity
            of ARC peoples organizations, such as the
            "barangay" implementing team, cooperatives,
            associations, farmers' groups, women's groups,
            producer groups, as well as strengthening the capacity of
            DAR and LGUs to support appropriate development activities.
            Component 2 provides essential rural infrastructure which
            contributes directly to sustaining increases in rural
            incomes of the target beneficiaries based on community
            demand-driven approach. The infrastructure includes rural
            roads, bridges, small-scale irrigation, potable water supply
            systems, post-harvesting facilities, and social buildings.
            Component 3 provides strategic support services to help
            generate viable increases in agricultural productivity and
            diversification. Component 4 comprises capacity building
            support to cooperatives and micrfinance institutions.
            Components 5 and 6 provide implementation and project
            management support, respectively.
